members.member:
Get or sets the rendering of spanned events (duration is more than 24 hours) in an all-day row or time slot (work area).
Accepts a enum value. The default value is SpannedEventPlacement.AllDayRow.
In the below code example, spanned events rendering regin is set to TimeSlot area.
Spanned events are rendered in allday row or within timeslot based on this property applicable for day, week and workweek views only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleEventSettings`1.MinimumEventDuration
member.summary: Get or sets a minimum duration for an event where the events are rendered for this minimum duration when the duration of the event is lesser than this value.
member.value: Accepts a duration value in minutes. The default value is 1 minute.
member.remarks: The events are rendered using MinimumEventDuration property when the event duration is lesser than MinimumEventDuration.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule
member.summary: An interface that holds properties of scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AgendaDaysCount
member.summary: Sets the number of days to be displayed by default in Agenda View and in case of virtual scrolling, the number of days will be fetched on each scroll-end based on this count.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: When set to `True`, allows the appointments to move over the time slots. When an appointment is dragged, both its start and end time tends to change simultaneously allowing it to reschedule the appointment on some other time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowInline
member.summary: This property helps user to add/edit the event in inline. By default, it is set to `False`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowKeyboardInteraction
member.summary: When set to `True`, allows the keyboard interaction to take place on Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowMultiCellSelection
member.summary: This property helps user to allow/prevent the selection of multiple cells. By default, it is set to `True`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowMultiRowSelection
member.summary: This property helps user to allow/prevent the selection of multiple days(rows). By default, it is set to `True`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.AllowResizing
member.summary: When set to `True`, allows the resizing of appointments. It allows the rescheduling of appointments either by changing the start or end time by dragging the event resize handlers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.CssClass
member.summary: It is used to customize the Schedule which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Schedule element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.CurrentView
member.summary: To set the active view on scheduler, the `currentView` property can be used and it usually accepts either of the following available view options.The view option specified in this property will be initially loaded on the schedule. * Day * Week * WorkWeek * Month * Year * Agenda * MonthAgenda * TimelineDay * TimelineWeek * TimelineWorkWeek * TimelineMonth * TimelineYear.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.DateFormat
member.summary: By default, Schedule follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `dateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `dateFormat` value or else based on the locale assigned to the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EnableRecurrenceValidation
member.summary: The recurrence validation will be done by default When this property is set to `False`, the recurrence validation will be skipped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EndHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Schedule ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EventDragArea
member.summary: It enables the external drag and drop support for appointments on scheduler, to be able to move them out of the scheduler layout. When the drag area is explicitly set with specific DOM element name, the appointments can be dragged anywhere within the specified drag area location.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EventSettings
member.summary: Complete set of settings related to Schedule events to bind it to local or remote dataSource, map applicable database fields and other validation to be carried out on the available fields.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Schedule. It should be based on the locale set to it and each culture defines its own first day of week values.If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property.It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ScheduleGroup
member.summary: Allows defining the group related settings of multiple resources. When this property is non-empty, it means that the resources will be grouped on the schedule layout based on the provided resource names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.HeaderRows
member.summary: Allows defining the collection of custom header rows to display the year, month, week, date and hour label as an individual row on the timeline view of the scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.Height
member.summary: Sets the `height` of the Schedule component, accepting both string and number values. The string type includes either pixel or percentage values. When `height` is set with specific pixel value, then the Schedule will be rendered to that specified space. In case, if `auto` value is set, then the height of the Schedule gets auto-adjusted within the given container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.HideEmptyAgendaDays
member.summary: The days which does not has even a single event to display will be hidden from the UI of Agenda View by default. When this property is set to `False`, the empty dates will also be displayed on the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.MaxDate
member.summary: To define the maximum date on the Schedule, `maxDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the new Date(2099, 11, 31).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.MinDate
member.summary: To define the minimum date on the Schedule, `minDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the new Date(1900, 0, 1).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.QuickInfoOnSelectionEnd
member.summary: This property helps to show quick popup after multiple cell selection. By default, it is set to `False`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.QuickInfoTemplates
member.summary: The template option to customize the quick window. The three sections of the quick popup whereas the header, content, and footer can be easily customized with individual template option.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.Readonly
member.summary: When set to `True`, makes the Schedule to render in a read only mode. No CRUD actions will be allowed at this time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ScheduleResources
member.summary: Allows defining the collection of resources to be displayed on the Schedule. The resource collection needs to be defined with unique resource names to identify it along with the respective dataSource and field mapping options.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.EnableAutoRowHeight
member.summary: When set to `True`, allows the height of the work-cells to adjust automatically based on the number of appointments present in those time ranges.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.SelectedDate
member.summary: To mark the active (current) date on the Schedule, `selectedDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the current System date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ShowHeaderBar
member.summary: When set to `False`, hides the header bar of the Schedule from UI. By default, the header bar holds the date and view navigation options, to which the user can add their own custom items onto it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ShowQuickInfo
member.summary: When set to `True`, displays a quick popup with cell or event details on single clicking over the cells or on events. By default, it is set to `True`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ShowTimeIndicator
member.summary: When set to `False`, hides the current time indicator from the Schedule. Otherwise, it visually depicts the live current system time appropriately on the user interface.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ShowWeekNumber
member.summary: When set to `True`, displays the week number of the current view date range. By default, it is set to `False`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ShowWeekend
member.summary: When set to `False`, it hides the weekend days of a week from the Schedule. The days which are not defined in the working days collection are usually treated as weekend days. Note: By default, this option is not applicable on `Work Week` view. For example, if the working days are defined as [1, 2, 3, 4], then the remaining days of that week will be considered as the weekend days and will be hidden on all the views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.StartHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the starting hour, from which the Schedule starts to display. It accepts the time string in a short skeleton format and also, hides the time beyond the specified start time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.TimeScale
member.summary: Allows to set different time duration on Schedule along with the customized grid count. It also has template option to customize the time slots with required time values in its own format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.Timezone
member.summary: Schedule will be assigned with specific timezone, so as to display the events in it accordingly. By default, Schedule dates are processed with System timezone, as no timezone will be assigned specifically to the Schedule at the initial time. Whenever the Schedule is bound to remote data services, it is always recommended to set specific timezone to Schedule to make the events on it to display on the same time irrespective of the system timezone.It usually accepts the valid[IANA] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) timezone names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.Width
member.summary: Sets the `width` of the Schedule component, accepting both string and number values. The string value can be either pixel or percentage format. When set to `auto`, the Schedule width gets auto-adjusted and display its content related to the viewable screen size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.WorkDays
member.summary: It is used to set the working days on Schedule. The only days that are defined in this collection will be rendered on the `workWeek` view whereas on other views, it will display all the usual days and simply highlights the working days with different shade.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.WorkHours
member.summary: The working hours should be highlighted on Schedule with different color shade and an additional option must be provided to highlight it or not.This functionality is handled through `workHours` property and the start work hour should be 9 AM by default and end work hour should point to 6 PM.The start and end working hours needs to be provided as Time value of short skeleton type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ResourceCollection
member.summary: It contains the collection of resources to be displayed on the Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ISchedule.ScheduleTemplates
member.summary: Template option to customize the scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ID
member.summary: Defines the Id of schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EventSettings
member.summary: Allows defining the events related settings of the schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ScheduleGroup
member.summary: Allows defining the group related settings of multiple resources. When this property is non-empty, it means that the resources will be grouped on the schedule layout based on the provided resource names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.HeaderRows
member.summary: Allows to configure the header rowe on timeline views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.QuickInfoTemplates
member.summary: This property holds the template option to customize the quick popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ScheduleResources
member.summary: Allows defining the collection of resources to be displayed on the Schedule. The resource collection needs to be defined with unique resource names to identify it along with the respective dataSource and field mapping options.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.TimeScale
member.summary: Allows to configure the time scale on Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ScheduleViews
member.summary: This property holds the views collection and its configurations. It accepts either the array of view names or the array of view objects that holds different configurations for each views.By default, Schedule displays all the views namely `Day`, `Week`, `Work Week`, `Month` and `Agenda`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.WorkHours
member.summary: Allows to configure the work hours on Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AgendaDaysCount
member.summary: Sets the number of days to be displayed by default in Agenda View and in case of virtual scrolling, the number of days will be fetched on each scroll-end based on this count.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the appointments to move over the time slots. When an appointment is dragged, both its start and end time tends to change simultaneously allowing it to reschedule the appointment on some other time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowInline
member.summary: When sets to 'true', allows inline creation and editing of appointments in the Scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowKeyboardInteraction
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the keyboard interaction to take place on Scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowMultiCellSelection
member.summary: This property helps user to allow/prevent the selection of multiple cells. By default, it is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowMultiRowSelection
member.summary: This property helps user to allow/prevent the selection of multiple days(rows). By default, it is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowResizing
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the resizing of appointments. It allows the rescheduling of appointments either by changing the start or end time by dragging the event resize handlers.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.AllowMultiDrag
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the dragging of multiple selected appointments.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnableAllDayScroll
member.summary: When set to `true`, If valid, the scroll on the all day row is activated when the all day row height reaches the max height when the all day row is expanded.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.CssClass
member.summary: It is used to customize the Scheduler which accepts custom CSS class names that defines specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Scheduler element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.CurrentView
member.summary: To set the active view on scheduler, the `CurrentView` property can be used and it usually accepts either of the following available view options. The view option specified in this property will be initially loaded on the scheduler. Day Week WorkWeek Month Agenda MonthAgenda TimelineDay TimelineWeek TimelineWorkWeek TimelineMonth TimelineYear Year.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.CurrentViewChanged
member.summary: Invokes when current view changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.DateFormat
member.summary: By default, Scheduler follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `DateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `DateFormat` value or else based on the locale assigned to the Scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.TimeFormat
member.summary: By default, Scheduler follows the time-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific time format by using the `TimeFormat` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnableRecurrenceValidation
member.summary: The recurrence validation will be done by default When this property is set to `false`, the recurrence validation will be skipped.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EndHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Scheduler ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EventDragArea
member.summary: It enables the external drag and drop support for appointments on scheduler, to be able to move them out of the scheduler layout. When the drag area is explicitly set with specific DOM element name, the appointments can be dragged anywhere within the specified drag area location.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnableAdaptiveUI
member.summary: When set to `true`, the header view navigations are listed under the popup and if we enable resource grouping, the compact view will be enabled. It's default value is false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Scheduler. It should be based on the locale set to it and each culture defines its own first day of week values. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.FirstMonthOfYear
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first month of the year on Scheduler. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 1 is always denoted as January, 2 as February and so on. This property is applicable only in timeline year views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.Height
member.summary: Sets the `Height` of the Scheduler component, accepting both string and number values. The string type includes either pixel or percentage values. When `Height` is set with specific pixel value, then the Scheduler will be rendered to that specified space. In case, if `auto` value is set, then the height of the Scheduler gets auto-adjusted within the given container.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.HideEmptyAgendaDays
member.summary: The days which does not has even a single event to display will be hidden from the UI of Agenda View by default. When this property is set to `false`, the empty dates will also be displayed on the Scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.MaxDate
member.summary: To define the maximum date on the Scheduler, `MaxDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the new DateTime(2099, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.MinDate
member.summary: To define the minimum date on the Scheduler, `MinDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the new DateTime(1900, 1, 1).

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.QuickInfoOnSelectionEnd
member.summary: This property helps to show quick popup after multiple cell selection. By default, it is set to `false`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.Readonly
member.summary: When set to `true`, makes the Scheduler to render in a read only mode. No CRUD actions will be allowed at this time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.EnableAutoRowHeight
member.summary: when set to `true`, allows the height of the work-cells to adjust automatically based on the number of appointments present in those time ranges.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.SelectedDate
member.summary: To mark the active (current) date on the Schedule, `SelectedDate` property can be defined. Usually, it defaults to the current System date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.SelectedDateChanged
member.summary: Invokes when selected date changes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ShowHeaderBar
member.summary: When set to `false`, hides the header bar of the Schedule from UI. By default, the header bar holds the date and view navigation options.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ShowQuickInfo
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays a quick popup with cell or event details on single clicking over the cells or on events. By default, it is set to `true`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ShowTimeIndicator
member.summary: When set to `false`, hides the current time indicator from the Scheduler. Otherwise, it visually depicts the live current system time appropriately on the user interface.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ShowWeekNumber
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays the week number of the current view date range. By default, it is set to `false`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.ShowWeekend
member.summary: When set to `false`, it hides the weekend days of a week from the Scheduler. The days which are not defined in the working days collection are usually treated as weekend days. Note: By default, this option is not applicable on `Work Week` view. For example, if the working days are defined as [1, 2, 3, 4], then the remaining days of that week will be considered as the weekend days and will be hidden on all the views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.StartHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the starting hour, from which the Scheduler starts to display. It accepts the time string in a short skeleton format and also, hides the time beyond the specified start time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.Timezone
member.summary: Scheduler will be assigned with specific timezone, so as to display the events in it accordingly. By default, Scheduler dates are processed with System timezone, as no timezone will be assigned specifically to the Scheduler at the initial time. Whenever the Scheduler is bound to remote data services, it is always recommended to set specific timezone to Scheduler to make the events on it to display on the same time irrespective of the system timezone. It usually accepts the valid [IANA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) timezone names.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.Width
member.summary: Sets the `Width` of the Scheduler component, accepting both string and number values. The string value can be either pixel or percentage format. When set to `auto`, the Schedule width gets auto-adjusted and display its content related to the viewable screen size.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.WorkDays
member.summary: It is used to set the working days on Scheduler. The only days that are defined in this collection will be rendered on the `WorkWeek` view whereas on other views, it will display all the usual days and simply highlights the working days with different shade.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.WeekRule
member.summary: It is used to set WeekRule on the Scheduler. The WeekRule is provided with three values - FirstDay, FirstFullWeek, FirstFourDayWeek. The default value is FirstDay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.MonthsCount
member.summary: It allows the user to set the number of months count to be displayed on the Schedule. The default value is 12.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.SfSchedule`1.TimezoneDataSource
member.summary: Allows defining the timezone datasource related settings for the schedule.

member.summary: It contains the collection of resources to be displayed on the Schedule.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView
member.summary: Configures the view-specific settings on scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.AllowVirtualScrolling
member.summary: It is used to allow or disallow the virtual scrolling functionality. This is applicable only on Timeline views and Agenda view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.EnableVirtualMask
member.summary: Enable or disable the virtual mask to the work cells for virtual scrolling actions.
member.remarks: The Virtual Mask allows it to render only work cells visible within the view-port without buffering the entire resource collection. Here, same set of DOM elements is re-used to improve the performance. In this feature, a loading placeholder indicator was shown while loading the new data.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.VirtualResourceCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of resources to be renders only in the content viewport.

example.code: <SfSchedule TValue="EventData" Height="550px"> <ScheduleGroup Resources="@GroupData"></ScheduleGroup> <ScheduleResources> <ScheduleResource TItem = "ResourceData" TValue="int[]" DataSource="@ResourceDatasource" Field="ResourceId" Title="Resource" Name="Resources" TextField="Text" IdField="Id" ColorField="Color" AllowMultiple="true"></ScheduleResource> </ScheduleResources> <ScheduleViews> <ScheduleView Option="View.TimelineMonth" AllowVirtualScrolling="true" VirtualResourceCount="20"></ScheduleView> </ScheduleViews> </SfSchedule>

member.remarks: property is only applicable for resources virtual scrolling in timeline views. If this property value is not set, then the number of resources to be displayed in the scheduler is determined implicitly by height of the content area. The provided count must be two times larger than the number of visible resources in the scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.CellHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the header template on the month date cells. This template is only applicable for month view day cells.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.CellTemplate
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized work cells on the Schedule. The field accessible via template is `Date`. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DateFormat
member.summary: By default, Schedule follows the date-format as per the default culture assigned to it. It is also possible to manually set specific date format by using the `DateFormat` property. The format of the date range label in the header bar depends on the `DateFormat` value or else based on the current culture. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DateRangeTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the header date range template to customize header date range.
member.value: Accepts the template of the header date range text in the Scheduler.
member.example:
In the below code example, a date range template has been rendered using within tag directive.
<SfSchedule> <ScheduleViews> <ScheduleView Option="View.Week"> <DateRangeTemplate> @((context as DateRangeTemplateContext).StartDate.ToString("dd ddd", CultureInfo.InvariantCulture)) </DateRangeTemplate> </ScheduleView> </ScheduleViews> </SfSchedule>
member.remarks: The parameters passed to the templates can be accessed using implicit parameter named context. The context is of type .

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DateHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the date header template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DayHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the day header template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.HeaderIndentTemplate
member.summary: Defines the header indent template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DisplayName
member.summary: When the same view is customized with different intervals, this property allows the user to set different display name for those views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.EndHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the end hour, at which the Schedule ends. It too accepts the time string in a short skeleton format.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.EventTemplate
member.summary: Defines the event template. All the event fields mapped to Schedule from dataSource can be accessed within this template code. It is similar to that of the `Template` option available within the `ScheduleEventSettings`, whereas it will get applied only on the events of the view to which it is currently being defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: This option allows the user to set the first day of a week on Schedule. It should be based on current culture and each culture defines its own first day of week values. If needed, the user can set it manually on his own by defining the value through this property. It usually accepts the integer values, whereby 0 is always denoted as Sunday, 1 as Monday and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.NumberOfWeeks
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of weeks that is shown in the month view.
member.value: The number of weeks shown in the month view. The default is derived from number of weeks in current month.
member.remarks: property is only applicable for month view. Use DisplayDate property to customize the starting week of month.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.DisplayDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting week date at an initial rendering of month view.
member.remarks: property is only applicable for month view. If this property value is not set, then the month view will be rendered from the first week of the month.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.FirstMonthOfYear
member.summary: It allows the user to set the first month of the year.It accepts the integer values, whereby 1 is always denoted as January, 2 for February and so on.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.HeaderRows
member.summary: Allows defining the collection of custom header rows to display the year, month, week, date and hour label as an individual row on the timeline view of the scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.Interval
member.summary: It accepts the number value denoting to include the number of days, weeks, workweeks or months on the defined view type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.IsSelected
member.summary: To denote whether the view name given on the `Option` is active or not. It acts similar to the `CurrentView` property and defines the active view of Schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.MonthHeaderTemplate
member.summary: Defines the month header template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.Option
member.summary: It accepts the schedule view name, based on which we can define with its related properties in a single object. The applicable view names are, Day Week WorkWeek Month Agenda MonthAgenda TimelineDay TimelineWeek TimelineWorkWeek TimelineMonth TimelineYear.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.Orientation
member.summary: It is used to specify the year view rendering orientation on the schedule.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.Readonly
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays a quick popup with cell or event details on single clicking over the cells or on events. By default, it is set to `false`. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.ResourceHeaderTemplate
member.summary: The template option which is used to render the customized header cells on the schedule. All the resource fields mapped within resources can be accessed within this template. It gets applied only to the view objects on which it is defined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.ShowWeekNumber
member.summary: When set to `true`, displays the week number of the current view date range.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.ShowWeekend
member.summary: When set to `false`, it hides the weekend days of a week from the Schedule. The days which are not defined in the working days collection are usually treated as weekend days. Note: By default, this option is not applicable on `Work Week` view. For example, if the working days are defined as [1, 2, 3, 4], then the remaining days of that week will be considered as the weekend days and will be hidden on all the views.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.StartHour
member.summary: It is used to specify the starting hour, from which the Schedule starts to display. It accepts the time string in a short skeleton format and also, hides the time beyond the specified start time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.WorkDays
member.summary: It is used to set the working days on schedule. The only days that are defined in this collection will be rendered on the `WorkWeek` view whereas on other views, it will display all the usual days and simply highlights the working days with different shade.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleView.MaxEventsPerRow
member.summary: It is used to set the maximum events count in a row when we disabled the `EnableAutoRowHeight` property.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup
member.summary: Configures the view-specific resource group on scheduler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.ChildContent
member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.AllowGroupEdit
member.summary: Allows creation and editing of linked appointments assigned to multiple resources. When set to `true`, a single appointment object instance will be maintained in schedule dataSource that are created for multiple resources, whereas displayed individually on UI.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.ByDate
member.summary: When set to `true`, groups the resources by date where each day renders all the resource names under it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.ByGroupID
member.summary: Decides whether to allow the resource hierarchy to group by ID. It is set to `true` by default and when set to false, all the resources under child collection will be mapped against each available parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.EnableCompactView
member.summary: Decides whether to display the resource grouping layout in normal or compact mode in mobile devices. When set to `false`, the default grouping layout on desktop will be displayed on mobile devices with scrolling enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.HeaderTooltipTemplate
member.summary: Template option to customize the tooltip that displays over the resource header bar. By default, no tooltip will be displayed on resource header bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.HideNonWorkingDays
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show/hide the non-working days.
member.value: true, to hide the non-working days. The default value is `false`.
member.remarks: This property is applicable, only when property is enabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewGroup.Resources
member.summary: Accepts the collection of resource names assigned to each resources and allows the grouping order on schedule based on it.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViews
member.summary: Configures the required views on the scheduler.

member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.summary: Dispose unmanaged resources in the Syncfusion Blazor component.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale

member.summary: Defines the child content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale.Enable
member.summary: When set to `true`, allows the schedule to display the appointments accurately against the exact time duration. If set to `false`, all the appointments of a day will be displayed one below the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale.Interval
member.summary: Defines the time duration on which the time axis to be displayed either in 1 hour or 30 minutes interval and so on. It accepts the values in minutes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale.MajorSlotTemplate
member.summary: The template option to be applied for major time slot cells. The time details can be accessed within this template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale.MinorSlotTemplate
member.summary: The template option to be applied for minor time slot cells. The time details can be accessed within this template.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleViewTimeScale.SlotCount
member.summary: Decides the number of slot count to be split for the specified time interval duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleWorkHours.Highlight

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Schedule.ScheduleWorkHours.Start
